result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael A. Pfaff was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Plea & Sentencing Hearing Held Oct. 18, 2017

15CF80/sentencing after rev, 15CF102/sentencing after rev, and 17CF78/status. Defendant Michael A. Pfaff in court, in custody, with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Atty. M states that the parties have a joint recommendation for a global resolution and are asking the Court to follow the agency's recommendation on the two revoked cases.

15CF80 - Count 3 - felony intimidate victim count is now subject to revocation. 15CF102 - Count 1 - misdemeanor bail jumping count is now subject to revocation. Comment by counsel. 

17CF78 - Def pleads no contest to Count 1/strangulation and Count 3/battery. Both have domestic abuse and repeater modifiers. Court's colloquy on pleas. Finding of guilty.

Sentence:

15CF80 - sentencing after revocation
3 years prison, 2 years extended supervision, 72 days credit. No costs owed yet. Prison program eligible. Conditions of ES: attend, pay for, and successfully complete any programming ordered.

15CF102 - sentencing after revocation
6 months jail concurrent with 15CF80. 72 days credit (as this is concurrent case). No costs owed yet. Prison program eligible. 

17CF78 - sentencing
Counts 1 and 3 - sentence withheld for 3 years probation, consecutive to the sentences imposed today in 15CF80 and 15CF102. Conditions: obey rules and regulations of probation. Pay one set of costs. Attend, pay for, and successfully complete any education or programming ordered by the agent. 0 days credit. Counts 2 and 4 DRI.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on October 18, 2017 at 11:00 am.

15CF80 and 15F102/on the calendar for status.  Defendant Michael A. Pfaff in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Atty. M states that the parties have reached an agreement; trial to be removed from the calendar; def wishes to proceed to plea/sentencing today.  ADA addresses the Court; states that the recommendation of the parties calls for amendment of one of the computer message counts in 15CF80 to be amended to 940.45(3)/also a felony and the single bail jumping count in 15CF102 to be amended from felony to misdemeanor for dispo of probation with conditions to include no contact except as authorized by agent.

State moves for amendment of count 3 in 15CF80 to felony intimidation of a victim per 940.45(3).  No objection from the Defense.  Amendment allowed, with permissible "legal fiction."  Def pleads no contest to the charge as amended as well as to the amended bail jumping charge in 15CF102.  Court's colloquy on plea.
Status conference on September 2, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Status in 15CF80 and 15CF102.  Defendant Michael A. Pfaff in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  ADA Forehand states this was to be the final status prior to trial in September for 15CF80; says that she needs time to confirm recently-received information; asks for reset of this final status to this Friday 9/2 at 2.  15CF102 tracking with 15CF80 for status.  Status conference scheduled for September 2, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Status conference on August 31, 2016 at 11:00 am.
